description.narrative: Sverige har gett stöd till utveckling av Ugandas kvalitetsinfrastruktur inom ramen för programmet "Quality Infrastructure and Standrards Programme", QUISP. Syftet är att de institutioner och regelverk som är en del av kvalitetsinfrastrukturen, dvs områden såsom standardisering, ackreditering, certifiering och mätning, ska uppfylla internationella krav och regelverk. En väl fungerande kvalitetsinfrastruktur främjar Ugandas regionala och internationella handel samt ökar den nationella konsumentsäkerheten. Avtalet med QUISP avsåg perioden 2010 - 2014 men utbetalningarna har stoppas vid olika tillfällen pga restriktioner i Sveriges samarbete med den ugandiska staten. Ambassaden har nu fått godkänt att förlänga avtalet med Uganda avseende QUISP, utan att tillföra nya medel, för att möjliggöra att slutföra de aktiviteter som planerats inom programmet. Syftet med detta avrop av konsulttjänster är att Handelsministeriet i Uganda samt ambassaden ska få tekniskt stöd i denna förlängning så att förväntade resultat av programmet kan säkerställas.

Sweden has supported the development of Uganda's quality infrastructure within the framework of the "Quality Infrastructure and Standards Programme", QUISP. The aim is that institutions, regulations and the legal framework that are part of the quality infrastructure (standardization, accreditation, certification and metrology) is in accordance with international requirements and regulations. A well-functioning quality infrastructure promotes Uganda's regional and international trade and improves local consumer protection. The agreement regarding QUISP covered the period 2010 - 2014 but implementation has been delayed caused by restrictions in payments of Swedish funds. The agreement will now be extended at no-cost to honor the committment made by Sweden and to secure delivery of expected and sustainable results. The purpose of the consulting services is to provide technical advice to the Ministry of Trade and the Embassy in the extension in order to ensure that reusults of the program can be reached.

description.narrative:
This intervention consists of Expert advice for the Quality Infrastructure and Standars programme, Uganda. Consultancy support/advice has been provided from the consultant during the period 2015/2016. The support has been provided through the Consultancy firm Orgut, carried out by sub contractor Sipu (Consultant Folke Hermansson Snickars). As stated in "Statement on Narrative and financial report (see green archive) deviations were found when Sidas was reviewing the budget and reports for the period March 2015- April 2016 (see Corruption case UM 2017/44963). Apart from the advice with regards to the Financial report year 1 and advice in relation to budget and procurement plan year 2, the Concultant has provided expert advice in form of input in the development of a program document for the extension of QUISP. The consultant has also provided input during annual and semi-annual reviews of the programme. The consultant has also been available for ad hoc consultancy.
The collaboration has overall been good and advice has been valuable. Due to terminination of agreement with the Agreement partner (Ministry of Trade, Industry and Cooperatives) there is no further need for consultancy support within this assigment.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
